analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, said by the Arahant, so I have heard:

original: Sukhā vedanā, dukkhā vedanā, adukkhamasukhā vedanā.
analyzed: sukhā vedanā dukkhā vedanā adukkhamasukhā vedanā
translated: Pleasant feeling, painful feeling, neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling.
Pleasant feeling should be seen as stress.
Painful feeling should be seen as a dart.
Neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling should be seen as inconstant.

original: Yato kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno sukhā vedanā dukkhato diṭṭhā hoti, dukkhā vedanā sallato diṭṭhā hoti, adukkhamasukhā vedanā aniccato diṭṭhā hoti;
analyzed: yatas kho bhikkhave bhikkhuno sukhā vedanā dukkhataḥ diṭṭhā hoti dukkhā vedanā sallataḥ diṭṭhā hoti adukkhamasukhā vedanā aniccataḥ diṭṭhā hoti
translated: When a monk sees pleasant feeling as stress, painful feeling as a dart, and neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling as inconstant,

original: ayaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, ‘bhikkhu ariyo sammaddaso acchecchi, taṇhaṁ, vivattayi saṁyojanaṁ, sammā mānābhisamayā antamakāsi dukkhassā’”ti.
analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave bhikkhu ariyaḥ sammaddasaḥ dukkhassa ati
translated: he is said to be a monk who sees rightly. He has cut off craving, thrown off the fetters, and through the total ending of conceit he has made an end of suffering and stress.”
And in reference to this, they say:
He saw suffering as a dart,

analyzed: sa veḥ yoga atigaḥ muni iti
translated: The sage has gone beyond all bonds.

original: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: This, too, was the meaning of what was said by the Blessed One, so I have heard.
